title: Australia, Umpires Labelled "Cheaters" By MCG Crowd For Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Drama. Video Viral - NDTV Sports
summary:
Australia Crowd Calls Umpires 'Cheaters' Over Jaiswal Dismissal Controversy

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The controversy surrounding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test has sparked widespread debate, particularly over a contentious third umpire decision that led to 'cheater' chants from the crowd.

  • Jaiswal was initially given not out on a caught-behind appeal but was overturned by the third umpire.
  • The decision was made without any spike detected on the Snicko technology.
  • India lost the match by 184 runs after a late collapse following Jaiswal's dismissal at 84 runs.
  • The incident has reignited discussions about the reliability of DRS (Decision Review System) in cricket.
  • A record crowd of 74,362 attended the match at the MCG.
The crowd is not having it. Been chanting non-stop for 10 mins now — Gaurav Kapur

This incident has raised questions about umpiring standards and the impact of technology in cricket, particularly during high-stakes matches like the Boxing Day Test.
newTitle: Australia Crowd Calls Umpires 'Cheaters' Over Jaiswal Dismissal Controversy

title: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides .. - NDTV Sports

BCCI vice president Rajeev Shukla criticizes the third umpire's decision regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test against Australia. The row highlights discrepancies in DRS technology usage.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on a controversial decision while batting on 84.
  • Shukla stated Jaiswal was clearly not out and that the third umpire should rely on technology.
  • Sunil Gavaskar and other cricket officials criticized the decision.

“Yashaswi jayaswal was clearly not out. Third umpire should have taken note of what technology was suggesting.” — Rajeev Shukla (@ShuklaRajiv)

This incident underscores ongoing debates about DRS and umpiring decisions in cricket.

title: Vinod Kambli dances his way through recovery: Ex-cricketer’s hospital moves go viral - Mint
summary:
Vinod Kambli dances his way through recovery: Ex-cricketer’s hospital moves go viral

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has become a viral sensation for his joyful dance in a Thane hospital while recovering from health issues.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital on December 21 due to a urinary infection and muscle cramps.
  • Tests revealed brain clots, but his health is reportedly improving.
  • A video showing him dancing has gone viral, bringing smiles to staff and fans.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude on social media for the support from fans and hospital staff.
  • He is known for his remarkable cricketing career, scoring 2,477 runs in ODIs and 1,084 runs in Test matches.
“I have reached this far because of your love.” - Vinod Kambli

This uplifting moment highlights the power of positivity and support during tough times.

title: Vinod Kambli Dances In Hospital During Recovery, Video Goes Viral - NDTV Sports
Jasprit Bumrah Nominated For ICC 'Test Cricketer of the Year' Award - News18
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Nominated For ICC 'Test Cricketer of the Year' Award

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, 20:35 IST, News18 Cricket

Indian vice-captain and ace fast-bowler Jasprit Bumrah is among the four nominees for the International Cricket Council (ICC) men’s ‘Test Cricketer of the Year’ Award for 2024. He’ll compete with England’s Joe Root and Harry Brook and Sri Lanka’s Kamindu Mendis for the prestigious award.

Bumrah had an exceptional 2024 in the longest format of the game. In 13 matches, he took a whopping 71 wickets — one more than his combined tally for the last four years — at an average of 14.92. He recorded as many as five five-wicket hauls in the year, including three in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Took 71 wickets in 13 Tests in 2024
  • Recorded five five-wicket hauls
  • Nominated alongside Joe Root, Harry Brook, and Kamindu Mendis

Bumrah started the year with spells of 2/25 and 6/61 against the Proteas at Newlands.

He’ll face stiff competition from Root, Mendis, and Brook, who also had remarkable years in Test cricket.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah's Stunning 2024 Earns Him ICC 'Test Cricketer of the Year' Nomination

title: Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch - News18
summary:
Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Boxing Day Test saw a controversial wicket as Yashasvi Jaiswal was adjudged out caught behind by the third umpire, overturning the on-field not-out decision, even when Snicko showed no evidence of an edge.

  • Jaiswal was on the fifth ball of the 71st over when the incident occurred.
  • The on-field umpire Joe Wilson initially ruled not out, leading to an appeal from Australia.
  • Third umpire Sharfuddoula reviewed the footage and decided to overrule, despite no conclusive Snicko evidence.
  • The crowd reacted negatively, with chants of 'cheaters' heard in the stadium.
  • Jaiswal scored 84 before his dismissal, and his wicket contributed to India’s precarious position at 140/7.
“The third umpire had enough evidence to overturn the on-field call, even though Snicko didn’t show any definitive touch.”

The incident has raised questions about the reliability of third umpire decisions and the technology used in similar situations.
newTitle: Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' After Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal

title: 'It Is Mentally Disturbing': Rohit Sharma Dejected After India's Poor Show In Melbourne - News18
summary:
India's Poor Show in Melbourne

Date & Source: Last Updated: December 30, 2024, 18:38 IST, News18

India's hopes of winning the Border-Gavaskar Trophy ended with a crushing defeat in the 4th Test against Australia in Melbourne. Chasing 340, India lost their top-three batsmen early, but Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rishabh Pant revived the innings. However, a batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat by 184 runs.

India captain Rohit Sharma described the performance as "mentally disturbing" and "disappointing".

  1. India lost the Test series 2-1.
  2. Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment and frustration.
  3. Batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat.
  4. Jasprit Bumrah, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Nitish Rana were the bright spots for India in the match.

"It is mentally disturbing when you can’t do what you have come to do... It is pretty disappointing. There are ways to win games and we fell short in finding ways to win the game here. We wanted to fight till the end and unfortunately, we couldn’t do it." - Rohit Sharma

Conclusion: India's defeat in Melbourne has left Rohit Sharma and the team dejected, with the captain expressing his frustration at their inability to win the game.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Disappointment After India's Defeat in Melbourne

title: Vinod Kambli's iPhone taken away by shopkeeper after he fails to pay just Rs... - DNA India
summary:
Vinod Kambli's iPhone taken away by shopkeeper after he fails to pay just Rs...

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 - Source: DNA India

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is currently facing serious health and financial challenges. Recently admitted to Akruti Hospital in Thane, he is recovering from health issues, while also struggling to pay maintenance fees that have accumulated to approximately Rs 18 lakh.

  • Kambli's iPhone was taken by a shopkeeper due to unpaid repair costs of Rs 15,000.
  • He has been hospitalized after suffering from clots in his brain.
  • Kambli relies on a BCCI pension of Rs 30,000 per month, which is insufficient to cover his expenses.
“My condition was severe at the time of admission, but medical professionals have since stabilized my health,” Kambli mentioned.

This situation highlights the extreme difficulties Kambli faces both personally and financially, underlining the importance of support for former athletes.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Faces Health and Financial Struggles: Phone Taken by Shopkeeper

title: Boxing Day Test: Afghanistan and Zimbabwe smash 7 tons, break all records - Mint
summary:
Boxing Day Test: Afghanistan and Zimbabwe smash 7 tons, break all records

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

The Test match between Zimbabwe and Afghanistan has marked a historic milestone, with both teams combining for an unprecedented seven centuries in Boxing Day Test history.

ZIM vs AFG Boxing Day Match: Record-Breaking Day

  • Afghanistan scored 699 runs in their first innings, their highest ever in Test cricket.
  • Zimbabwe scored 586 runs, featuring centuries from Sean Williams, Craig Ervine, and Brian Bennett.
  • The match took place at the Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo.
  • Rahmat Shah and Hashmatullah Shahidi formed a record partnership of 361 runs for Afghanistan.
  • This pairing is now the second-highest partnership on Zimbabwean soil in Test history.
  • Bennett became the youngest player to score a century and achieve a five-wicket haul in a men's Test match.
🚨Record Alert🚨 The Test match between Zimbabwe and Afghanistan has witnessed the most centuries in Boxing Day Test history🤯

Records fell as both sides set new benchmarks for run totals and partnerships, showcasing an extraordinary level of competition and sportsmanship.
newTitle: Boxing Day Test: Afghanistan and Zimbabwe smash 7 tons, break all records

title: 'Dropped or omitted, it's the same': Sunil Gavaskar questions Rohit Sharma's clarification on Shubman Gil - The Times of India
summary:
'Dropped or omitted, it's the same': Sunil Gavaskar questions Rohit Sharma's clarification on Shubman Gill's exclusion

Date: [Date not provided] | Source: Times of India

The article discusses Rohit Sharma's explanation regarding Shubman Gill's exclusion from the team for the Boxing Day Test against Australia and Sunil Gavaskar's reaction to it.

  • Rohit claims that Shubman was not dropped, but rather accommodated for an all-rounder for strategic reasons.
  • Gavaskar disagrees, stating that this decision constitutes dropping the player regardless of the terminology used.
  • Gavaskar remarked that both 'omit' and 'drop' lead to the same outcome, indicating Gill's absence from play.
  • The Indian team lost the Test match, further intensifying the scrutiny over the decision made by the captain.
Gavaskar stated, "You can only call it dropped in whichever language you might speak."

The crux of the article highlights the ongoing debate over decision-making within the team, especially under high-pressure scenarios and the interpretations surrounding player selections.
newTitle: 'Dropped or omitted, it's the same': Gavaskar critiques Rohit's explanation on Gill's exclusion

Irfan Pathan says that captaincy is the reason Rohit Sharma is in the playing XI - The Times of India
summary:
Irfan Pathan critiques Rohit Sharma's captaincy influence on playing XI

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Times of India

Former Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan raises concerns about Rohit Sharma's position in the Indian Test cricket team following a poor performance. He suggests that Rohit continues to play primarily due to his role as captain, despite his ongoing batting struggles.

  • Rohit Sharma's batting average in the recent Tests is only 6.20, with two ducks in five innings.
  • Pathan believes Rohit's captaincy is the main reason he remains in the team.
  • Alternative players like K.L. Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shubman Gill might have had opportunities if not for Rohit’s captaincy.
  • Pathan expresses disappointment over Rohit's current form and portrayal of his past performance against England.
“A player who has made about 20,000 runs—yet the way Rohit is struggling now, it seems his form is not supporting him at all.” - Irfan Pathan

In summary, Irfan Pathan argues that Rohit Sharma's captaincy is the primary factor keeping him in the playing XI, despite his crucial batting difficulties and low scores in recent matches.

Former cricketer Monty Panesar discusses Shubman Gill's performance and potential return to the Indian team for the final Test against Australia in Sydney. Gill's inconsistencies have raised concerns about his position in the team.

  • Shubman Gill has been considered a rising star in cricket but has struggled to convert starts into significant scores.

summary:

The legendary Sunil Gavaskar criticized senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli following India's defeat in the Boxing Day Test against Australia, blaming the top-order for their failure to chase a target of 340 runs.

  • India lost the match by 184 runs, trailing 1-2 in the five-match series.

title: 'Proud of dadda': Jasprit Bumrah's son steals hearts amid record-breaking performance - The Times of India
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah's Son Melts Hearts After Record-Breaking Performance

Publication Date: [Date], Source: Times of India

India's ace pacer Jasprit Bumrah may have ended on the losing side in the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, but a heartwarming family moment stole the spotlight. After his remarkable nine-wicket haul in the match, including 5 for 57 in the second innings, a picture of Bumrah's son holding the match ball went viral, melting fans' hearts across social media. The image, shared by Bumrah's wife, Sanjana Ganesan, captured their son holding the ball with which his father clinched his five-wicket haul. Sanjana's caption, "Proud of dadda, today and every day," resonated with fans, turning the touching moment into a trending sensation online.

  1. Bumrah achieved 200 Test wickets in just 44 matches, making him the fastest Indian pacer to reach the milestone and joint-second overall.
  2. He created history as the only bowler to claim 200 or more Test wickets with a sub-20 average.
  3. Bumrah has taken 30 wickets in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, the most by a visiting bowler in a single series on Australian soil since 1992.
"Proud of dadda, today and every day." - Sanjana Ganesan

Despite India's 184-run loss to Australia, Bumrah's performance was exceptional, and the viral picture offered a glimpse of the man beyond the records - a proud father, sharing his joy with his family.
newTitle: A Heartwarming Family Moment: Jasprit Bumrah's Son Steals Hearts Amidst Record-Breaking Performance

title: Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

New Zealand 186 for 5 (Chapman 42, Hay 41, Robinson 41) beat Sri Lanka 141 (Perera 48, Duffy 4-15) by 45 runs.

In a convincing second T20I victory, New Zealand's comprehensive team effort saw them emerge victorious over Sri Lanka, securing a 2-0 series lead.

  • New Zealand set a target of 187 runs for Sri Lanka, who struggled to achieve it, managing only 141 runs.
  • Jacob Duffy's exceptional bowling performance, taking 4 wickets for just 15 runs, played a crucial role in New Zealand's win.
  • Mitchell Hay was named player of the match for his explosive 41 runs off just 19 balls.
  • Sri Lanka's batting woes continued, with their inability to finish innings strongly raising concerns.
  • Key contributors for Sri Lanka included Kusal Perera and Pathum Nissanka, but their efforts were not enough.
  • New Zealand displayed controlled aggression and effective running between the wickets, significantly outpacing Sri Lanka.
“Duffy's 4 for 15 was far and away the best bowling effort, as he provided crucial breakthroughs across Sri Lanka's innings.”

This victory highlights New Zealand's dominance in the series thus far, leaving Sri Lanka searching for answers as they continue to struggle in away conditions.
newTitle: Jacob Duffy Shines as New Zealand Secures 2-0 Lead Against Sri Lanka
